conversation.content: Let me see here... I need to cancel my trial before, um, before it charges tomorrow?
Alright, I can—no wait, let me just pull up your account first. What's the email address associated with the subscription?
Okay so it's sarah.chen at gmail. Hmm, wait, what if I used my work email instead?

No problem, I'll check both. So I'm seeing—er, actually there's two accounts here. One trial started November 3rd at 11:47 PM, and the other's from October 28th. Which service were you looking to cancel?
The November one. That's the... what's the word... the premium tier thing?
Got it, got it.
So this definitely cancels before I get charged, right? Because next time I'm just—sorry, I mean, I don't want any surprises.

I understand completely. Let me just—hold on, the system's being slow here. Okay so your trial for account ID PRE-7743-NK expires tomorrow at 11:47 PM, and, uh, I'm canceling it now so you won't be charged the $89.99 monthly fee.
Eighty-nine? I thought it was—no wait, that's the annual price. Okay so that means I'm good?
Actually I'm—hmm, that's odd. The cancellation button is... what's the word I'm looking for... grayed out? Let me try a different screen.
Oh great. Let me guess, there's some kind of problem?
No no, I just need to—er, sorry, wrong menu. Here we go. Sometimes with trials started after 11 PM, the system requires, um, manual override. Bear with me just another second.
Hmm, okay but like, this is definitely getting canceled today, right? What if the system charges me anyway?
Oh absolutely not, I won't let that happen. So what I'm doing—actually wait, I need your ZIP code to verify. The one on file ends in 4102?
That's the old—sorry, I mean the current one's 94107.

Perfect, updating that now. Alright so, uh, here's what's happening. The trial cancellation is processing, confirmation number CAN-8827-XKRM, and it'll be fully canceled within, mmm, about 15 minutes.
Fifteen minutes? Okay so... so that means I should get an email or something?

Yes exactly. Two emails actually—one right now that says pending, and then the final confirmation by 6:45 PM your time. And honestly, if there's any charge at all, which there won't be, but if somehow there is, reference that CAN-8827-XKRM number and we'll refund immediately.
Alright, I guess that works. Next time though I'm just, er, not doing free trials at all.

I hear you, I really do. These trial periods can be—hmm, frustrating is an understatement. But you're all set, canceled as of 6:31 PM, no charges, and if you ever want to come back, there's a 40% discount code in that confirmation email.
